Container.Name: ryansend
Container.Overview:
ryansend lets you share files on your computer via public download URLs with cryptographic tokens that automatically expire. Perfect for sharing large files directly from your home server without needing special software, accounts, or VPNs.
Features: • Share large files (tested with over 70GB) • Generates secure URLs with automatic expiration (1 hour default) • Optional admin web interface for browsing and sharing • No database required - tokens contain encrypted file paths • Extremely lightweight (~32MB Docker image, 8MB RAM idle) • Works without JavaScript for fast page loads • No external tracking or requests (except optional ko-fi link)
The admin panel (if enabled) will be available at /admin/login with a randomly generated password shown in the container logs.

Config.Name: Sharing Port
Config.Description: Main ryansend port for file sharing URLs.

Config.Name: AppData
Config.Description: Where ryansend will write its config. The config files are small so this location doesn't need much storage capacity. ryansend never copies the shared files to this location. Example: /mnt/user/ryansend

Config.Name: Shared Files
Config.Description: The path to the files you intend to make shareable. These files don't become public just because you mount them! Files only become downloadable once you manually click the

Config.Name: Admin Panel Port
Config.Description: ryansend runs the admin panel on a different port from the path that shares files

Config.Name: Remove Ko-fi Link
Config.Description: ryansend includes a link to a donation ko-fi page on the admin page. It is never shown to the person downloading, just you when you are browsing the files to share. It isn't intrusive, but you can turn it off if you donate (or if you just want to).

Config.Name: Log Level
Config.Description: Logging level (error, warn, info, debug, trace)

Config.Name: Enable Admin Panel
Config.Description: Enable the web admin interface for browsing and sharing files (recommended unless you want to only share files via command line)

Config.Name: Admin HTTPS Port
Config.Description: The port the admin panel should run on when configured with HTTPS. Requires adding a cert file and key manually or with the letsencrypt features via the admin panel.

Config.Name: PUID
Config.Description: User ID that the container will run as

Config.Name: PGID
Config.Description: Group ID that the container will run as
